column1:
LettuceBrick,"2016-08-06T07:05:59.083Z","Take a Hike? Gladly!","

If you need a companion for your outdoor adventures, look no further: the plucky Hiker will gladly follow your trail.
The Hiker comes in a foil pack, as do all CMFs.
The Hiker comes with appropriately tousled hair for an adventurer of his caliber. His backpack is a new mold in light and darker blue. It accurately reflects a typical backpacker'
column2: s backpack. Two tiles are included: a map and a compass. The map is a 2x2 tile referring to the Greeble Trail, an allusion to the small detailing often found on larger MOCs to break up blank spaces. The compass is a clear 1x1 tile with a compass pattern printed upon it. Both are excellent accessories and quite useful in other applications.&nbsp
brand new windbreaker torso which includes printed straps for his backpack. The legs are nicely printed with pockets and double molded to give the impression of hiking boots.&nbsp

column1: The Hiker is a pretty basic minifig with no special construction requirements.

column2: s the minifig.&nbsp

column1: The Hiker is probably not a figure you want an army of, but it is worth picking
column2: up. The backpack element and compass make him&nbsp

column1: ,TRUE,5,5,4,5,4 tatez","2016-10-09T02:03:38.073Z","Great Set! My Favorite of the series!!!!!","
This set comes in a mystery pack, so you don'
column2: t know what minifigure out of the 16 in the series you will end up with!&nbsp

column1: This set has some very cool parts!
The backpack is a very cool, good looking part. It has duel
column2: molding in two different colors of blue. It has a rolled up sleeping bag that is molded in light blue with the rest of the backpack in dark blue. The two prints in the set: The map and the AWESOME compass are both out of this world! The head has a second side that has a very realistic lost-face!

column1: The figure itself is also very cool. The torso has a print that has the backpack straps from
column2: the backpack looking very realistic. He is wearing a green zip-up hoodie. His pants are duel molded also, in tan and brown.

column1: This set is very easy to build, considering
column2: that it only had 8 parts.

column1: THIS SET IS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! it looks sooooooooooooo cool when you are done building and is ready to set off on a hike.
This set is well worth the $4.99 price!!! I love the backpack and compass so much. I recommend this set for any LEGO fan!

,TRUE,5,5,3,4,5 Odeinoichus","2017-09-04T18:00:12.583Z","Hiking through LEGO City Park.","

Set #71013 Hiker: Well here'
column2: s another ordinary looking character, but boy did they do a lot with the printing for him.

column1: The Hiker features dual-molded legs with plain brown boots and light tan pants, or possibly hiking shorts. He'
column2: s got some pockets and a belt printed on it, the torso however is very detailed with a slightly darker green plain ABS used showing a multicoloured jacket with blues, greens and whites, some dark blue straps meant to evoke his backpack element is also included.
s the first double-sided facial print, with a big happy smile on one side and a lost looking expression on the other, apparently even with his printed map and compass elements he&#39
column3: s gone and gotten himself lost. The backpack accessory is brand new and looks great, I can&#39
column4: t wait to see this part used in LEGO City Camping sets in different colours for some great reuses of the part.

column1: While being a bit of a weaker offering from the set he'
column2: s still got a strong overall look to him and would fit in perfectly with your Fun in the Park set or other LEGO City displays. I&#39
column3: d recommend him because of that and his very useful new map print, which features something different from the same old Pirates map prints we&#39
column4: ve seen time and time again in the past.

,TRUE,3,2,1,3,3 donner89","2020-08-07T16:23:07.55Z","Awesome minifig - my favorite from Series 16","

As an avid hiker myself, this minifig immediately got my attention and was one of the first CMF I went out of my way to obtain.

column2: s start at the top and work our way down:
good set of hair, nothing crazy or special to point out

column1: Face - He has two expressions - a joyfull smile and an uncertain/second guessing smirk. I think both work great with this guy. When posing/playing with this, you can make him happy that he'
column2: s out and exploring the world&nbsp
column3: or you can have the uncertain expression to show an &#39
column4: uh oh, i took a wrong turn&#39

column1: Upperbody - While the back is just green, the front makes up for it and really pairs well with the backpack. You'
column2: ve got a green/blue jacket and then the straps from the backpack coming in, which really complements the backpack accessary nicely. The backpack itself is nice too - it&#39
column3: s a great blue color with a rolled up sleeping back at the top.

column1: Lowerbody - Decent set of cargo pants with some brown boots
Additional accessories - You get a compass and a map. The compass is straightforward and the map has some good details, the "
column2: Greeble Trail&quot
column3: is a nice reference to a certain building technique.

column2: s a great minifig, easily my favorite from Series 16.&nbsp
